intro: Aster ageratoides subsp. yakushimensis, commonly known as the Yakushimen aster, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in the mountainous regions of southern Japan. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
